name: unpunctual
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not arriving, doing something, or happening at the expected or correct time: The trains were notoriously unpunctual. They say he is disorganized, unpunctual, and incompetent. Opposite
punctualCompare
lateRelated word
unpunctuality
More examplesFewer examplesHe's terribly unpunctual, I'm afraid. Commuters already have to put up with unpunctual, filthy, and ruinously expensive train services.You should write to the unpunctual employee, explaining your concerns about his time-keeping, and asking him to attend a meeting. Many people think trains and buses will become less rather than more punctual, and a large proportion believe they will remain as unpunctual as ever.
